1. In Your Account, select Login & Security.
2. Select Set up next to Passkey.
3. Select Set up.
4. Follow the instructions provided to complete setting up a passkey.

Signing in to different Amazon marketplaces (Amazon.co.uk compared to Amazon.com for example) requires either a new passkey for that specific marketplace or using your Amazon password.

fidoalliance.org.content:
CVS Health is a U.S. healthcare organization that includes multiple operating divisions including retail with CVS Pharmacy, which has nearly 10,000 locations across America. CVS Health also includes a large healthcare insurance business that integrates assets from Aetna.



As of Q2 2023, CVS Health is using passkeys for consumer logins to their mobile web service.



The Challenge/ Use Case



The key focus for CVS Health is to ensure integrity and confidentiality of customer data. The overall user experience also needs to be positive, to drive traffic to CVS's digital assets. 



CVS Health is on a path to help make its consumer authentication experience not only secure, but easier to use. CVS Health is also on a path toward enabling password-less experiences for consumers wherever possible.



"For the external user, they would just simply walk away, if the user log in experience is cumbersome, in any way," Cisa Kurian, senior security advisor at CVS Health commented. "Good security is always a balance between security and usability."



How CVS Health Uses FIDO To Secure Its Users



CVS Health is building out an authentication platform to provide password-less authentication capabilities in its web, mobile, IoT and voice applications. Passwordless authentication is enabled with biometric authentication using FIDO standards



"Our goal is to increase friction for a potential threat actor, while enabling ease of use for the legitimate user," Kurian said.



Benefits



By adopting a FIDO based approach, CVS Health is able to provide an easier authentication experience for its users. Making the login experience more seamless also helps to improve the overall user experience as well.



"We chose FIDO because the standards are open, and allow for simpler and stronger authentication that is based on public key cryptography," Kurian said. "In other words, it's easy to use and more secure, at the same time."

passkeys.directory.name: Microsoft
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

fidoalliance.org.content:
The Challenge



With phishing attacks on the rise, it was imperative for the government to support “phish-proof” multi-factor authentication (MFA) technology that was also user-friendly, efficient and cost-effective.



The Solution



After evaluating several options for authentication for login.gov, the government decided to support FIDO2 through the use of FIDO security keys and built-in FIDO authenticators like Windows Hello biometrics. Through comparison to other options, they found FIDO to check the box for security, usability, cost and compliance.



The Results



GSA rolled out authentication with FIDO2 in September 2018. With initial adoption equating to about 2,000, or 0.2%, of new users, GSA made it a requirement for users to register a second MFA option. As a result, the number of new FIDO2 security keys increased to 17,000 per month. In late June 2019, there were about 27,000 FIDO2 keys registered and the adoption rate has increased to about 3% of all new users, representing a significant increase from initial rollout.



Resources



Case Study: U.S. General Services Administration’s Rollout of FIDO2 on login.gov

Through comparison to other options, they found FIDO to check the box for security, usability, cost and compliance.



The Results



GSA rolled out authentication with FIDO2 in September 2018. With initial adoption equating to about 2,000, or 0.2%, of new users, GSA made it a requirement for users to register a second MFA option. As a result, the number of new FIDO2 security keys increased to 17,000 per month. In late June 2019, there were about 27,000 FIDO2 keys registered and the adoption rate has increased to about 3% of all new users, representing a significant increase from initial rollout.



Resources



Case Study: U.S. General Services Administration’s Rollout of FIDO2 on login.gov

passkeys.directory.name: Microsoft
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

passkeys.directory.name: Roblox
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Setting up passkeys: 

- Navigate to Settings on your iOS app or web browser. Log in if prompted.
*Note: Android support will be coming soon*
- Under Account Info > Login Methods > Passkeys, press the “Add passkey” button.
- Note: You may need to verify your identity with your password or a one-time code sent to your email.

To complete adding a passkey, you will be asked to unlock your device.


### Manage your passkeys

Go to Settings on your iOS app or web browser. Login to your account if prompted.

*Note: Android support will be coming soon*
- Under Account Info > Login Methods > Passkeys, press the “Manage” button.
- Press the trashcan icon next to the passkey you want to remove.
- You may be asked to verify your identity using passwords or an email one-time code.

[Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Google uses FIDO Authentication for both its employees and users. 



On the employee side, there has not been a successful phishing attack against Google’s 85,000+ employees since requiring use of FIDO security keys. 



On the user side, Google’s goal is to have as many users as possible on phishing-resistant authentication protocols, whether they utilize a security key, an on-device biometric authenticator, or a cryptographic handshake with the users’ mobile device.



In 2023, Google announced support for passkeys for its billions of consumer accounts and 9 million business accounts.



Resources



Article: The Verge: Google trials passwordless login across Workspace and Cloud accounts



Article: Wired: Google Is Rolling Out Password-Killing Tech to All Accounts



Authenticate 2020 Video: Web Authentication: Enterprise Features & Other Level 2 Additions



Case Study (2019): Defending Against Phishing



Case Study (2016): Google Security Keys Work

hideez.com.name: Google
hideez.com.content: Physische Sicherheitsschlüssel können für die Bestätigung in zwei Schritten verwendet werden, um Hacker von Ihren Google-Konten (Gmail, Google Apps, Google Maps, YouTube, Hangouts usw.) fernzuhalten. Jedes Mal, wenn Sie sich von einem neuen Computer oder Gerät aus anmelden, werden Sie nach Ihrem Sicherheitsschlüssel oder einem weiteren zweiten Schritt gefragt.

hideez.com.name: Google Express
hideez.com.content: Mit Google Express können Nutzer mit der Google Express-App, dem Google-Sprachassistenten oder über den Desktop unter google.com/express in einer Vielzahl von Geschäften einkaufen. Beim Einkaufen können Benutzer Artikel in einen zentralen Warenkorb legen, anstatt wie bei Google Shopping auf die Website des einzelnen Einzelhändlers geleitet zu werden, um einen Kauf abzuschließen. Es schafft ein schnelles und einfaches Einkaufserlebnis.

hideez.com.name: Youtube
hideez.com.content: YouTube ist ein Video-Sharing-Dienst, bei dem Nutzer ihr eigenes Profil erstellen, Videos hochladen, andere Videos ansehen, liken und kommentieren können. Schützen Sie Ihr YouTube-Konto mit hardwaregestützter 2FA vor unbefugtem Zugriff.

passkeys.directory.notes:
Passkeys can be setup within iOS and available to use on desktop after.
No Android support yet.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Gemini is a cryptocurrency exchange and custodian, founded by Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss in 2014. Gemini enables its users to transact both via a website as well as mobile apps to buy, sell and store cryptocurrency assets.



The Challenge/ Use Case



As a financial services vendor in a space that is highly targeted by criminals, the need for strong authentication is paramount. 



Gemini's security efforts are led by Chief Security Officer Dave Damato who is no stranger to the security industry and previously worked at security incident response firm Mandiant.



"So much of my career has been really focused on preventing and responding to incidents and strong two factor authentication is at the core preventing most of those attacks," Damato said (in a session at the Authenticate Financial Services Summit). "It's also why I'm so very enthusiastic about FIDO."



How Gemini Uses FIDO To Secure Its Users



Gemini wanted to provide its users with the strongest level of security authentication to help minimize risk.



While using an SMS based two factor approach can be better than just a username and password, given the high value of a Gemini account, attackers might well go through the steps necessary to bypass SMS two factor. Beginning in 2019, Gemini began offering its customers the highest level of security possible and it did this by starting to support the FIDO2 authentication standard.



"FIDO2 is designed to overcome challenges and dramatically increase the cost for an attacker," Damato said. "There's no password that can be shared by our customers and that's why FIDO2 is phishing resistant."



Benefits



For Gemini, the use of FIDO2 provides a series of tangible risk mitigation benefits that helps to reduce the attack surface. Instead of needing to rely on a One-Time Password (OTP), SMS or backup codes, Gemini users can benefit from a more user-friendly FIDO2 powered experience.



Among the most common types of attack is credential stuffing, where an

passkeys.com.description: Cryptocurrency exchange for buying and trading digital assets.

hideez.com.name: Gemini
hideez.com.content:
Gemini ist die weltweit erste Krypto-Börse und Verwahrstelle, die das WebAuthn-Sicherheitsprotokoll unterstützt. Sie können Hardware-Sicherheitsschlüssel, MacOS TouchID und sogar Windows Hello als Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierungsmethode (2FA) verwenden, wenn Sie sich bei Ihrem Gemini-Konto anmelden.

Um die Sicherheit von GeoIP-Webdiensten zu erhöhen, können Sie jetzt einen (FIDO U2F) Sicherheitsschlüssel zusätzlich zu Ihren Kontoanmeldeinformationen hinzufügen und anfordern, um sich sicherer anzumelden. Informationen zum Einrichten von 2FA finden Sie in unserem Support-Center-Benutzerhandbuch.

### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Anyone using a consumer Microsoft account can go completely passwordless. You can now delete your password from your Microsoft account—or set up a new account with no password—and sign-in using other more secure and convenient authentication methods such as Windows Hello or FIDO security keys.



Resources



Microsoft Blog: The passwordless future is here for your Microsoft account



Authenticate 2020 Video: Microsoft presents success strategies for your strong authentication journey



Authenticate 2020 Video: Passwordless; Are we there yet?



Authenticate 2020 Video: Profiles, PINS and Protections, Oh My!

hideez.com.name: Microsoft
hideez.com.content: Microsoft hat die Möglichkeit aktiviert, sich mit einem standardbasierten FIDO2-kompatiblen Gerät sicher bei Ihrem Microsoft-Konto anzumelden – kein Benutzername oder Kennwort erforderlich! hideez.com.name: Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD)

Benutzer können sich registrieren und dann einen Hideez-Schlüssel auf der Anmeldeoberfläche als Hauptauthentifizierungsmittel auswählen.

passkeys.directory.name: Apple
passkeys.directory.notes:
Passkeys for Apple accounts are automatically generated by any Apple devices signed in to an Apple ID running iOS 17 or macOS Sonoma or newer. You will then be able to sign in with passkeys on Apple using any iOS device or Mac signed in to the same Apple ID you are signing in to.

If you are using a different browser or device, such as a Windows PC or Mac signed in with a different Apple ID, you can scan the QR code using your iOS device and sign in with passkeys on Apple.

You are not yet able to save passkeys for Apple ID accounts in third-party credential managers and can only be stored in iCloud Passwords at this time.

passkeys.directory.name: Amazon
passkeys.directory.notes:
Amazon is actively rolling out sign in with passkey support. Setting up a passkey on Amazon needs to meet one of the minimum software requirements of iOS 16, macOS Big Sur, or Android 9 (if applicable).

#### To set up a passkey on your Amazon account:

1. In Your Account, select Login & Security.
2. Select Set up next to Passkey.
3. Select Set up.
4. Follow the instructions provided to complete setting up a passkey.

Signing in to different Amazon marketplaces (Amazon.co.uk compared to Amazon.com for example) requires either a new passkey for that specific marketplace or using your Amazon password.

hideez.com.name: AWS Single Sign-On
hideez.com.content: AWS SSO verfügt über native WebAuthn-Unterstützung, um den Benutzerzugriff auf AWS-Konten und Geschäftsanwendungen mithilfe einer starken, FIDO-basierten Multi-Faktor-Authentifizierung zu sichern. Sie können sich mit einer Vielzahl von FIDO-fähigen Authentifikatoren authentifizieren – tippen Sie auf Ihren Hideez Key, berühren Sie einen Fingerabdrucksensor auf Ihrem Mac oder verwenden Sie die Gesichtserkennung auf Ihrem Mobilgerät oder PC.

hideez.com.name: AWS Identity and Access Management
hideez.com.content: U2F-Sicherheitsschlüssel sind eine Art MFA-Gerät, mit dem Sie Ihre AWS-Ressourcen schützen können. Sie können den Schlüssel mit Ihrem Computer koppeln und ihn mithilfe der folgenden Anweisungen aktivieren. Tippen Sie auf die Taste, wenn Sie dazu aufgefordert werden, um den Anmeldevorgang sicher abzuschließen.

passkeys.directory.name: WhatsApp (iOS and Android)
passkeys.directory.notes:
Saving and signing in with a passkey on Whatsapp is currently limited to the iOS and Android apps. Signing in to the Mac desktop version or on the web browser version of Whatsapp still requires using the "Linked Devices" feature or scanning the QR code using your mobile device.

#### To set up a passkey on your Whatsapp account:
1. Go to your WhatsApp settings.
2. Tap Passkeys > Create a passkey.
3. Tap Continue.
- You may be asked to tap Use screen lock to create your passkey.

Saving and signing in with a passkey on Whatsapp is currently limited to the iOS and Android apps. Signing in to the Mac desktop version or on the web browser version of Whatsapp still requires using the "Linked Devices" feature or scanning the QR code using your mobile device.

#### To set up a passkey on your Whatsapp account:
1. Go to your WhatsApp settings.
2. Tap Passkeys > Create a passkey.
3. Tap Continue.
- You may be asked to tap Use screen lock to create your passkey.

passkeys.directory.name: Microsoft
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

hideez.com.name: Microsoft
hideez.com.content: Microsoft hat die Möglichkeit aktiviert, sich mit einem standardbasierten FIDO2-kompatiblen Gerät sicher bei Ihrem Microsoft-Konto anzumelden – kein Benutzername oder Kennwort erforderlich! Benutzer können sich registrieren und dann einen Hideez-Schlüssel auf der Anmeldeoberfläche als Hauptauthentifizierungsmittel auswählen.

hideez.com.name: Okta
hideez.com.content: Ein Okta-Administrator kann MFA auf Organisations- oder Anwendungsebene konfigurieren. Wenn beide Ebenen aktiviert sind, werden Endbenutzer aufgefordert, ihre Anmeldeinformationen mit Faktoren zu bestätigen, wenn sie sich bei Okta anmelden und auf eine Anwendung zugreifen. Endbenutzer können einen U2F-kompatiblen Sicherheitsschlüssel wie Hideez Key verwenden, um sich bei Okta anzumelden.

hideez.com.name: Salesforce
hideez.com.content: Als Salesforce-Administrator können Sie Benutzern erlauben, einen U2F-Sicherheitsschlüssel zu verwenden, wann immer sie aufgefordert werden, ihre Identität zu bestätigen. Anstatt Salesforce Authenticator oder OTPs zu verwenden, die per E-Mail oder SMS gesendet werden, verwenden Benutzer den Sicherheitsschlüssel in das entsprechende oder mobile Gerät, um die Verifizierung abzuschließen.

For Yahoo! JAPAN, the act of signing in is the entry point to all of its services. This makes it critical that the experience at that entry point is a positive one for all users. JAPAN turned to FIDO Authentication.

At the same time, it’s equally critical that every user’s personal information is well protected. To find the right balance between convenience and security, Yahoo! JAPAN turned to FIDO Authentication.



Resources



Case Study: Yahoo! JAPAN turns to FIDO Authentication for Enhanced Login

fidoalliance.org.content:
Google uses FIDO Authentication for both its employees and users. 



On the employee side, there has not been a successful phishing attack against Google’s 85,000+ employees since requiring use of FIDO security keys. 



On the user side, Google’s goal is to have as many users as possible on phishing-resistant authentication protocols, whether they utilize a security key, an on-device biometric authenticator, or a cryptographic handshake with the users’ mobile device.



In 2023, Google announced support for passkeys for its billions of consumer accounts and 9 million business accounts.



Resources



Article: The Verge: Google trials passwordless login across Workspace and Cloud accounts



Article: Wired: Google Is Rolling Out Password-Killing Tech to All Accounts



Authenticate 2020 Video: Web Authentication: Enterprise Features & Other Level 2 Additions



Case Study (2019): Defending Against Phishing



Case Study (2016): Google Security Keys Work

passkeys.directory.name: Microsoft
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

passkeys.directory.name: X (Twitter) iOS
passkeys.directory.notes:
X (formerly Twitter) is rolling out signing in with passkeys support to all accounts on iOS. No other platforms are able to save a passkey to their accounts at this time.

**To set up a passkey on your X account:**
1. Log in to the X app with the account you wish to enable passkey for.
2. Select Your account in the navigation bar.
3. Select Settings and privacy, select Security and account access, then Security.
4. Under Additional password protection, select Passkey.
5. Enter your password when prompted.
6. Select Add a passkey and follow the on-screen prompts.

Twitter also implemented security keys internally across its workforce to help prevent security incidents. They migrated from a variety of phishable 2FA methods to using security keys as the only supported 2FA method on internal systems. Learn more about their rollout here.

### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Google uses FIDO Authentication for both its employees and users. 



On the employee side, there has not been a successful phishing attack against Google’s 85,000+ employees since requiring use of FIDO security keys. 



On the user side, Google’s goal is to have as many users as possible on phishing-resistant authentication protocols, whether they utilize a security key, an on-device biometric authenticator, or a cryptographic handshake with the users’ mobile device.



In 2023, Google announced support for passkeys for its billions of consumer accounts and 9 million business accounts.



Resources



Article: The Verge: Google trials passwordless login across Workspace and Cloud accounts



Article: Wired: Google Is Rolling Out Password-Killing Tech to All Accounts

passkeys.directory.name: Roblox
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Setting up passkeys: 

- Navigate to Settings on your iOS app or web browser. Log in if prompted.
*Note: Android support will be coming soon*
- Under Account Info > Login Methods > Passkeys, press the “Add passkey” button.
- Note: You may need to verify your identity with your password or a one-time code sent to your email.

To complete adding a passkey, you will be asked to unlock your device.


### Manage your passkeys

Go to Settings on your iOS app or web browser. Login to your account if prompted.

*Note: Android support will be coming soon*
- Under Account Info > Login Methods > Passkeys, press the “Manage” button.
- Press the trashcan icon next to the passkey you want to remove.
- You may be asked to verify your identity using passwords or an email one-time code.

### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

passkeys.directory.name: Microsoft
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Anyone using a consumer Microsoft account can go completely passwordless. You can now delete your password from your Microsoft account—or set up a new account with no password—and sign-in using other more secure and convenient authentication methods such as Windows Hello or FIDO security keys.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Gemini is a cryptocurrency exchange and custodian, founded by Tyler and Cameron Winklevoss in 2014. Gemini enables its users to transact both via a website as well as mobile apps to buy, sell and store cryptocurrency assets.



The Challenge/ Use Case



As a financial services vendor in a space that is highly targeted by criminals, the need for strong authentication is paramount. 



Gemini's security efforts are led by Chief Security Officer Dave Damato who is no stranger to the security industry and previously worked at security incident response firm Mandiant.



"So much of my career has been really focused on preventing and responding to incidents and strong two factor authentication is at the core preventing most of those attacks," Damato said (in a session at the Authenticate Financial Services Summit). "It's also why I'm so very enthusiastic about FIDO."



How Gemini Uses FIDO To Secure Its Users



Gemini wanted to provide its users with the strongest level of security authentication to help minimize risk.



While using an SMS based two factor approach can be better than just a username and password, given the high value of a Gemini account, attackers might well go through the steps necessary to bypass SMS two factor. Beginning in 2019, Gemini began offering its customers the highest level of security possible and it did this by starting to support the FIDO2 authentication standard.



"FIDO2 is designed to overcome challenges and dramatically increase the cost for an attacker," Damato said. "There's no password that can be shared by our customers and that's why FIDO2 is phishing resistant."



Benefits



For Gemini, the use of FIDO2 provides a series of tangible risk mitigation benefits that helps to reduce the attack surface. Instead of needing to rely on a One-Time Password (OTP), SMS or backup codes, Gemini users can benefit from a more user-friendly FIDO2 powered experience.



Among the most common types of attack is credential stuffing, where an

hideez.com.name: Gemini
hideez.com.content:
Gemini ist die weltweit erste Krypto-Börse und Verwahrstelle, die das WebAuthn-Sicherheitsprotokoll unterstützt. Sie können Hardware-Sicherheitsschlüssel, MacOS TouchID und sogar Windows Hello als Zwei-Faktor-Authentifizierungsmethode (2FA) verwenden, wenn Sie sich bei Ihrem Gemini-Konto anmelden.

Um die Sicherheit von GeoIP-Webdiensten zu erhöhen, können Sie jetzt einen (FIDO U2F) Sicherheitsschlüssel zusätzlich zu Ihren Kontoanmeldeinformationen hinzufügen und anfordern, um sich sicherer anzumelden. Informationen zum Einrichten von 2FA finden Sie in unserem Support-Center-Benutzerhandbuch.

passkeys.directory.name: Apple
passkeys.directory.notes:
Passkeys for Apple accounts are automatically generated by any Apple devices signed in to an Apple ID running iOS 17 or macOS Sonoma or newer. You will then be able to sign in with passkeys on Apple using any iOS device or Mac signed in to the same Apple ID you are signing in to.

If you are using a different browser or device, such as a Windows PC or Mac signed in with a different Apple ID, you can scan the QR code using your iOS device and sign in with passkeys on Apple.

You are not yet able to save passkeys for Apple ID accounts in third-party credential managers and can only be stored in iCloud Passwords at this time.

passkeys.directory.name: Amazon
passkeys.directory.notes:
Amazon is actively rolling out sign in with passkey support. Setting up a passkey on Amazon needs to meet one of the minimum software requirements of iOS 16, macOS Big Sur, or Android 9 (if applicable).

#### To set up a passkey on your Amazon account:

1. In Your Account, select Login & Security.
2. Select Set up next to Passkey.
3. Select Set up.
4. Follow the instructions provided to complete setting up a passkey.

Signing in to different Amazon marketplaces (Amazon.co.uk compared to Amazon.com for example) requires either a new passkey for that specific marketplace or using your Amazon password.

hideez.com.name: AWS Single Sign-On
hideez.com.content: AWS SSO verfügt über native WebAuthn-Unterstützung, um den Benutzerzugriff auf AWS-Konten und Geschäftsanwendungen mithilfe einer starken, FIDO-basierten Multi-Faktor-Authentifizierung zu sichern. Sie können sich mit einer Vielzahl von FIDO-fähigen Authentifikatoren authentifizieren – tippen Sie auf Ihren Hideez Key, berühren Sie einen Fingerabdrucksensor auf Ihrem Mac oder verwenden Sie die Gesichtserkennung auf Ihrem Mobilgerät oder PC.

hideez.com.name: AWS Identity and Access Management
hideez.com.content: U2F-Sicherheitsschlüssel sind eine Art MFA-Gerät, mit dem Sie Ihre AWS-Ressourcen schützen können. Sie können den Schlüssel mit Ihrem Computer koppeln und ihn mithilfe der folgenden Anweisungen aktivieren. Tippen Sie auf die Taste, wenn Sie dazu aufgefordert werden, um den Anmeldevorgang sicher abzuschließen.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Google uses FIDO Authentication for both its employees and users. 



On the employee side, there has not been a successful phishing attack against Google’s 85,000+ employees since requiring use of FIDO security keys. 



On the user side, Google’s goal is to have as many users as possible on phishing-resistant authentication protocols, whether they utilize a security key, an on-device biometric authenticator, or a cryptographic handshake with the users’ mobile device.



In 2023, Google announced support for passkeys for its billions of consumer accounts and 9 million business accounts.



Resources



Article: The Verge: Google trials passwordless login across Workspace and Cloud accounts



Article: Wired: Google Is Rolling Out Password-Killing Tech to All Accounts



Authenticate 2020 Video: Web Authentication: Enterprise Features & Other Level 2 Additions



Case Study (2019): Defending Against Phishing



Case Study (2016): Google Security Keys Work

passkeys.directory.name: X (Twitter) iOS
passkeys.directory.notes:
X (formerly Twitter) is rolling out signing in with passkeys support to all accounts on iOS. No other platforms are able to save a passkey to their accounts at this time.

**To set up a passkey on your X account:**
1. Log in to the X app with the account you wish to enable passkey for.
2. Select Your account in the navigation bar.
3. Select Settings and privacy, select Security and account access, then Security.
4. Under Additional password protection, select Passkey.
5. Enter your password when prompted.
6. Select Add a passkey and follow the on-screen prompts.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Twitter has enabled its users to log in more securely with a FIDO Security Key. Learn more about Twitter’s FIDO deployment on their website.



Twitter also implemented security keys internally across its workforce to help prevent security incidents. They migrated from a variety of phishable 2FA methods to using security keys as the only supported 2FA method on internal systems. Learn more about their rollout here.

passkeys.directory.name: Amazon
passkeys.directory.notes:
Amazon is actively rolling out sign in with passkey support. Setting up a passkey on Amazon needs to meet one of the minimum software requirements of iOS 16, macOS Big Sur, or Android 9 (if applicable).

#### To set up a passkey on your Amazon account:

1. In Your Account, select Login & Security.
2. Select Set up next to Passkey.
3. Select Set up.
4. Follow the instructions provided to complete setting up a passkey.

Signing in to different Amazon marketplaces (Amazon.co.uk compared to Amazon.com for example) requires either a new passkey for that specific marketplace or using your Amazon password.

hideez.com.name: AWS Single Sign-On
hideez.com.content: AWS SSO verfügt über native WebAuthn-Unterstützung, um den Benutzerzugriff auf AWS-Konten und Geschäftsanwendungen mithilfe einer starken, FIDO-basierten Multi-Faktor-Authentifizierung zu sichern. Sie können sich mit einer Vielzahl von FIDO-fähigen Authentifikatoren authentifizieren – tippen Sie auf Ihren Hideez Key, berühren Sie einen Fingerabdrucksensor auf Ihrem Mac oder verwenden Sie die Gesichtserkennung auf Ihrem Mobilgerät oder PC.

hideez.com.name: AWS Identity and Access Management
hideez.com.content: U2F-Sicherheitsschlüssel sind eine Art MFA-Gerät, mit dem Sie Ihre AWS-Ressourcen schützen können. Sie können den Schlüssel mit Ihrem Computer koppeln und ihn mithilfe der folgenden Anweisungen aktivieren. Tippen Sie auf die Taste, wenn Sie dazu aufgefordert werden, um den Anmeldevorgang sicher abzuschließen.

[Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. fidoalliance.org.content:
CVS Health is a U.S. healthcare organization that includes multiple operating divisions including retail with CVS Pharmacy, which has nearly 10,000 locations across America. CVS Health also includes a large healthcare insurance business that integrates assets from Aetna.



As of Q2 2023, CVS Health is using passkeys for consumer logins to their mobile web service.



The Challenge/ Use Case



The key focus for CVS Health is to ensure integrity and confidentiality of customer data. The overall user experience also needs to be positive, to drive traffic to CVS's digital assets. 



CVS Health is on a path to help make its consumer authentication experience not only secure, but easier to use. CVS Health is also on a path toward enabling password-less experiences for consumers wherever possible.



"For the external user, they would just simply walk away, if the user log in experience is cumbersome, in any way," Cisa Kurian, senior security advisor at CVS Health commented. "Good security is always a balance between security and usability."



How CVS Health Uses FIDO To Secure Its Users



CVS Health is building out an authentication platform to provide password-less authentication capabilities in its web, mobile, IoT and voice applications. Passwordless authentication is enabled with biometric authentication using FIDO standards



"Our goal is to increase friction for a potential threat actor, while enabling ease of use for the legitimate user," Kurian said.



Benefits



By adopting a FIDO based approach, CVS Health is able to provide an easier authentication experience for its users. Making the login experience more seamless also helps to improve the overall user experience as well.



"We chose FIDO because the standards are open, and allow for simpler and stronger authentication that is based on public key cryptography," Kurian said. "In other words, it's easy to use and more secure, at the same time."

passkeys.directory.name: Microsoft
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

### Setting up passkeys: 

- Navigate to Settings on your iOS app or web browser. Log in if prompted.

*Note: Android support will be coming soon*
- Under Account Info > Login Methods > Passkeys, press the “Manage” button.
- Press the trashcan icon next to the passkey you want to remove.
- You may be asked to verify your identity using passwords or an email one-time code.

fidoalliance.org.content:
Target is a retailer with locations across the U.S as well as online ecommerce operations. Target also provides loyalty and credit card services to its customers.



The Challenge/ Use Case



The initial use case for FIDO at Target was to help enable a secure login experience across applications at the company, as part of a broader platform modernization effort.



Target's challenge was to provide a consistent and secure login experience across applications at Target, to provide a seamless experience to its users. 



"We had to reduce friction, wherever possible, be it in the authentication flow by reducing the dependencies on passwords, or in the onboarding process by making it easier for applications and business owners to easily consume the enterprise authentication services," explained Nataraj Rao, Principal Engineer for Security Solutions at Target.



How Target Uses FIDO To Secure Its Users



Target initially integrated a FIDO server with its Single Sign On (SSO) platform to provide multi-factor strong authentication capabilities.



"Support for a wide variety of authenticators makes it possible for team members to choose from a wide variety of authenticators and avoids a scenario where they are not able to move forward, just because they did not have a specific authenticator at that time," Rao said.



With a solid understanding of how FIDO works and how it can be integrated with Target's systems there are multiple use cases where it can be deployed. Among those use cases is for providing additional verification, in a multi factor authentication flow. FIDO can be used as the primary authenticator and can completely eliminate passwords from the login equation. It can be used for native authentication to mobile applications, providing a very intuitive login experience for Target's mobile users.



Benefits



FIDO2 in particular has been useful for Target as it's integrated into most modern web browsers without the need for users to install any

passkeys.directory.name: X (Twitter) iOS
passkeys.directory.notes:
X (formerly Twitter) is rolling out signing in with passkeys support to all accounts on iOS. No other platforms are able to save a passkey to their accounts at this time.

**To set up a passkey on your X account:**
1. Log in to the X app with the account you wish to enable passkey for.
2. Select Your account in the navigation bar.
3. Select Settings and privacy, select Security and account access, then Security.
4. Under Additional password protection, select Passkey.
5. Enter your password when prompted.
6. Select Add a passkey and follow the on-screen prompts.

fidoalliance.org.content:
CVS Health is a U.S. healthcare organization that includes multiple operating divisions including retail with CVS Pharmacy, which has nearly 10,000 locations across America. CVS Health also includes a large healthcare insurance business that integrates assets from Aetna.



As of Q2 2023, CVS Health is using passkeys for consumer logins to their mobile web service.



The Challenge/ Use Case



The key focus for CVS Health is to ensure integrity and confidentiality of customer data. The overall user experience also needs to be positive, to drive traffic to CVS's digital assets. 



CVS Health is on a path to help make its consumer authentication experience not only secure, but easier to use. CVS Health is also on a path toward enabling password-less experiences for consumers wherever possible.



"For the external user, they would just simply walk away, if the user log in experience is cumbersome, in any way," Cisa Kurian, senior security advisor at CVS Health commented. "Good security is always a balance between security and usability."



How CVS Health Uses FIDO To Secure Its Users



CVS Health is building out an authentication platform to provide password-less authentication capabilities in its web, mobile, IoT and voice applications. Passwordless authentication is enabled with biometric authentication using FIDO standards



"Our goal is to increase friction for a potential threat actor, while enabling ease of use for the legitimate user," Kurian said.



Benefits



By adopting a FIDO based approach, CVS Health is able to provide an easier authentication experience for its users. Making the login experience more seamless also helps to improve the overall user experience as well.



"We chose FIDO because the standards are open, and allow for simpler and stronger authentication that is based on public key cryptography," Kurian said. "In other words, it's easy to use and more secure, at the same time."

passkeys.directory.name: Microsoft
passkeys.directory.notes:
### Creating a passkey To create a passkey for your Microsoft account, follow these steps on the device for which you’d like to create a passkey: 1. [Sign in to your Microsoft account Advanced Security Options](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=2250685) for personal accounts, or [MyAccount Security info](https://mysignins.microsoft.com/security-info) for work or school accounts. 2. Choose Add a new way to sign in or verify. 3. Select Face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 4. Follow the instructions on your device. 5. Provide a name for your passkey.
---
### Using your passkey to sign in To sign into your Microsoft account with a passkey, follow these steps whenever you get a sign-in prompt. 1. Choose Sign-in options, or Other ways to sign in. 2. Select Face, Fingerprint, PIN, or security key. 3. Select your passkey from the list available. Your device will open a security window where you can use your face, fingerprint, PIN, or security key.
---
You can only create a device passkey for a work or school account if your organization supports it.
Passkeys cannot be added to Microsoft 365 Business accounts at this time.

2fa.directory.notes: Teams using Duo with 1Password can't enable other 2FA methods. Non-U2F Hardware tokens and custom software methods are only available through Duo.

hideez.com.name: 1Password
hideez.com.content: Die auf den Menschen ausgerichtete Sicherheit von 1Password schützt die Menschen bei der Arbeit und zu Hause. Seine Lösung ist von Grund auf so konzipiert, dass jeder – unabhängig von technischen Kenntnissen – ohne Angst oder Reibung durch die digitale Welt navigieren kann, und gestaltet die Zukunft der Authentifizierung neu, einschließlich passwortloser Authentifizierung. 1Password genießt das Vertrauen von über 100.000 Unternehmen wie IBM, Slack, Snowflake, Shopify und Under Armour und schützt die sensibelsten Informationen von Millionen von Einzelpersonen und Familien auf der ganzen Welt. Das ultimative Ziel des Unternehmens ist es, Verbrauchern und Unternehmen dabei zu helfen, in kürzerer Zeit mehr zu erledigen – mit Sicherheit und Datenschutz als Selbstverständlichkeit.

Visit www.playstation.com/passkey to learn more.

fidoalliance.org.content:
For Yahoo! JAPAN, the act of signing in is the entry point to all of its services. This makes it critical that the experience at that entry point is a positive one for all users. At the same time, it’s equally critical that every user’s personal information is well protected. To find the right balance between convenience and security, Yahoo! JAPAN turned to FIDO Authentication.
